snippet: Harriman State Park, where Eugene Palmer, who is suspected of fatally shooting his daughter-in-law, apparently fled, is an ideal place in which to live off the land, survival experts said.
abstract: Survival experts say that Eugene Palmer, believed to have shot and killed his daughter-in-law and then fled into New York's Harriman State Park, could live off the land in the park's lush forests; 73-year-old Palmer's skills as an outdoorsman could give him an edge in survival.
lead_paragraph: Harriman State Park, where Eugene Palmer, who is suspected of fatally shooting his daughter-in-law, apparently fled, is an ideal place in which to live off the land, survival experts said.

headline.seo: Eugene Palmer, Wanted for Murder, Could Survive in Harriman State Park
headline.main: Wanted Man Could Survive in Wilderness
headline.print_headline: Wanted Man Could Survive in Wilderness
